courseName: Build a Sport Sales Network in the USA 2026

intent.oneSentence: Teach operators how to design, launch, and scale a multi-motion sport sales network across B2C, B2B, and B2G in the United States while staying procurement- and partner-ready.
outcomes: Blueprint multi-segment sales motion with tailored ICPs, packages, territories, and channels.
Operate a three-playbook system with direct and partner-led routes, partner enablement, and risk controls.
Launch compliant procurement-ready programs for US federal, EU, and MENA buyers with a 90-day rollout plan and measurable KPIs.
nonGoals: Deep product training (this course presumes product familiarity).
Certified enablement for specific CRM vendors (we cover patterns, not tool-specific instructions).

concepts.valueChainMapping: Understand the players who pay, decide, use, and block in sport sales.
concepts.segmentMotioning: Differentiate B2C, B2B, B2G economics, KPIs, and processes.
concepts.partnerEcosystem: Direct vs partner-led coverage, partner selection, enablement, incentives.
concepts.procurementReadiness: Federal tender discovery, EU/MENA entry paths, compliance checklists.
concepts.rolloutCadence: 90-day plan with KPIs, launch checklist, reporting cadence, risk playbooks.

procedures.name: Pipeline blueprint per motion
steps: Define stages with exit criteria and evidence.
Document success metrics for each stage.
Calibrate forecasting hygiene with real evidence.

procedures.name: Partner enablement system
steps: Select partner types and document differentiation.
Design onboarding, certification, and co-marketing sequences.
Define incentives, deal protection, and escalation rules.

procedures.name: Procurement readiness handoff
steps: Map discovery boards for US federal, EU, MENA tenders.
Build compliance checklist and outreach scripts.
Align risk playbooks with contracts and escalation paths.

midCourse.evaluation: Review evidence for each stage, qualification rigor, MEDDICC alignment

final.evaluation: Assess roll-out cadence, partner coverage, KPIs, procurement readiness
